related_links.placement: Right before sub-heds to minimize reading interruption
related_links.style: Bold, normal font:type 'Related: Article Title' with title linked
related_links.source: Search Entrepreneur.com for related articles from the last few years
related_links.note: Contributors should add these while building the story:can link to own past stories if relevant

content_rules: Content must be 100% original and previously unpublished
Advice-driven articles sharing thoughts, experiences, and problem-solving techniques
No interviews or quotes from non-household name business leaders/experts
No overly promotional content:articles bolster credibility, not promote
No paid links or mentions:no editorial coverage in exchange for compensation
No profiles or Q&As of non-household name entrepreneurs
No ChatGPT/AI-generated text:articles are run through AI detector
No photos:leave all imagery to editors
Factual accuracy required:confirm facts using several sources
Can repost on own website/blog 10 days after publication with link back to original
link_policy: Only link a few words at a time (not whole phrases:distracting to readers)
Cite reputable publications, not blogs (including your own)
Can link to your own blog maximum one time per story (editors may remove if self-promotional)
For statistics, link to the original study, not another article citing the study
When quoting someone, link to the original source
Do NOT link to Forbes, Fast Company, or Inc. (competitors)
Put in your own hyperlinks:do not put URLs in parentheses or citations below
conflicts_of_interest: Discouraged from writing about anything with financial relationship
Discouraged from writing about anyone with social relationship
If mentioning friends or business partners, check with editor first
If approved, must disclose the relationship in the story

style_rules.serial_comma_note: OVERRIDE: Entrepreneur does NOT use serial comma (apples, oranges and bananas):this overrides the BriteCo brand guide for this publication
style_rules.em_dashes: Do NOT use em dashes. Use commas, periods, colons, or parentheses instead.
style_rules.quotation_marks: Commas and periods go inside end quote marks ALWAYS
style_rules.single_quotes: Only around quotes within quotes and in headlines/subheads:nowhere else
style_rules.formatting: No bold, no italics (except publication titles), no all-caps words (unless company name is stylized that way)
style_rules.subheads: At least 2 subheads per article:Heading 2 format, lowercase sentence format, no period at end, parallel structure
style_rules.pronouns: Be consistent:if you start with 'you', stick with it. Avoid mixing we/I/he/she/you
style_rules.pronouns_gender: Use gender-neutral language:pluralize to use 'they' when possible
style_rules.company_pronouns: A company/organization is 'it' never 'they':use 'its' not 'their' for possessive
style_rules.verb_tense: Be consistent throughout:present perfect for ongoing/habitual action
style_rules.numbers: Under 10 written out (unless percentages). 10+ as numerals (unless starting a sentence). Years always numerals. Use % sign not 'percent'. Use 'more than' not 'over' with numbers.
style_rules.names: Full name on first reference (Mark Zuckerberg). Last name only after (Zuckerberg). Never first name only.
style_rules.quotes_sourcing: Check quotes with reliable sources:Brainyquote and unedited blogs are not reliable
style_rules.jargon: Spell out abbreviations/acronyms on first reference with abbreviation in parentheses. Avoid 'SMB'.
style_rules.repetition: Check for repetition of same words, points, and themes
style_rules.evergreen: Try to keep content useful indefinitely:avoid dating to specific moment in time where possible

avoid: Serial comma (Entrepreneur does NOT use it)
Linking to Forbes, Fast Company, or Inc. (competitors)
Bold text, italics (except publication titles), all-caps words
URLs in parentheses instead of embedded hyperlinks
